page.title: 10Rawreth newspaper reports.
page.content: June 2-8.The Government is cutting benefits for single unemployed people under 26 from Â£49 per week to an amount between Â£17-30 and Â£25-70, according to age. The Yellow Advertiser is backing an appeal for Â£30,000 to buy a Kurzweil reading machine for the blind. N.U.T. strikes will affect 21 Essex schools next week.Teachers want more than a 5% pay rise. Basildon people have welcomed the news of proposed extensions at Stansted Airport.Extra jobs created will help the Basildon unemployed. On June 3rd at South Woodham Ferrers a train crashed into level crossing gates when a warning bell failed. There will be a public meeting in Rawreth Parish Hall on June 13th about speeding and heavy traffic in Church Road.
